title: Ticket #2072: condor_credd does not support High Availability setup
description:
The thread discussion the issue is archived at https://lists.cs.wisc.edu/archive/condor-devel/2011-March/msg00008.shtml

When using a HA configuration on Windows, it is not possible to setup condor_credd with failover in the same fashion as the other critical daemons, leaving a single point of failure in the setup.

Matthew Farrellee noted:

The HAD process that Gabi is talking about is just one HA strategy Condor uses. The Master provides another, which is used for HA Schedd setups.

That said, with the Credd storing date in the Windows registry, neither approach to HA will work.

Right now there are two Credd implementations. In the 7.7 timeframe they'll probably be merged and won't rely on the Windows register, which will make Master based HA possible.
